H0.text: The total area of the field is the other information a student must obtain to estimate the number of dandelion plants after counting plants in a 5‑square‑meter section.

H1.text: Average rainfall in the area is the information the student needs to obtain after counting dandelion plants in a 5‑square‑meter section of the field to estimate the total number of plants.

H2.text: All the organisms living in the field is the additional information the student should obtain to estimate the total number of dandelion plants after counting the plants in a 5‑square‑meter section.

H3.text: Energy and nutrient requirements of dandelions are the other information the student should obtain to estimate the number of dandelion plants in a field after counting the plants in a 5‑square‑meter section.

A4.text: 1 square kilometre is (103)2 (106, one million) times the area of 1 square metre.
